Package fr.Infuseting.entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
fr.Infuseting.entity.Entity
fr.Infuseting.entity.Player
public class Player extends Entity
extends the Entity class Represents a player with a maximum Mana pool, a current mana level in addition to his Entity stats.
Author:
Antoine

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Creates a basic player with static stats.

    • Player

      public Player(int currentHP, int maximumHP, int armor, int attack, int currentMana, int maxMana, List<Spell> spells)
      Creates a player with specified stats.
      Parameters:
      currentHP - The base amount of HP the player has (equals the maxium HP when constructed)
      maximumHP - The maximum amount of HP the player can have.
      armor - The amount of armor the player has.
      attack - The amount of attack power the player has.
      currentMana - The base amount of mana the player has.
      maxMana - The maximum amount of mana the player can have.
      spells - The list of spells the player has.

    • Player

      public Player(int currentHP, int maximumHP, int armor, int attack, int currentMana, int maxMana)
      Creates a player with specified stats.
      Parameters:
      currentHP - The base amount of HP the player has (equals the maxium HP when constructed)
      maximumHP - The maximum amount of HP the player can have.
      armor - The amount of armor the player has.
      attack - The amount of attack power the player has.
      currentMana - The base amount of mana the player has.
      maxMana - The maximum amount of mana the player can have.

  • Method Details

    • castSpell

      public void castSpell(Spell spell, Entity target)
      Makes this player cast a spell to the targetted Entity.
      Parameters:
      spell - The specified spell that is used by the player.
      target - The Entity that is targetted by the spell.

    • getUsableSpells

      public List<Spell> getUsableSpells()
      Retrieves a list of spells that the player can currently use. A spell is considered usable if its mana cost is less than or equal to the player's current mana.
      Returns:
      A list of usable spells.
